extractions.description: This paper explores the stability and convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm. It addresses both theoretical dynamical systems properties and empirical validation through machine learning applications.

title.value: ON THE STABILITY OF A NON-HYPERBOLIC NONLINEAR MAP WITH NON-BOUNDED SET OF NON-ISOLATED FIXED POINTS WITH APPLICATIONS TO MACHINE LEARNING
title.justification: This is the official title provided at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: ON THE STABILITY OF A NON-HYPERBOLIC NONLINEAR MAP WITH NON-BOUNDED SET OF NON-ISOLATED FIXED POINTS WITH APPLICATIONS TO MACHINE LEARNING

type.justification: The paper includes both theoretical analysis of the SUCPA algorithm's convergence properties and empirical validation using real-world datasets.
type.quote: Numerical experiments on real-world application are performed to support the theoretical results by means of two different classification problems

research_field.justification: The paper investigates a machine learning algorithm (SUCPA) in the context of stability and validation against neural network models like GPT-2 and ResNet-18.
research_field.quote: The SUCPA algorithm was first developed in the context of supervised machine learning classifiers.

sub_research_field.justification: The main focus of the paper is on the convergence and stability of the SUCPA algorithm, which is used for calibration of machine learning classifiers.
sub_research_field.quote: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm

name.justification: The entire paper is centered around the SUCPA algorithm, analyzing its convergence and stability properties.
name.quote: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm

type.justification: SUCPA is described as a calibration algorithm for adjusting machine learning model outputs.
type.quote: SUCPA algorithm was first developed in the context of supervised machine learning classifiers

name.justification: The SST-2 dataset was used for sentiment polarity classification as part of the numerical experiments.
name.quote: For this experiment, a subset of the SST-2 dataset [28], which contains examples of annotated movie reviews was used

name.justification: The MNLI dataset was used to illustrate multi-class classification problems in the paper.
name.quote: We choose the MNLI dataset [33], which contains examples of sentence pairs with textual entailment annotations.

name.justification: The Asirra dataset was used for the cat-dog image classification experiment.
name.quote: The final example shows that the features shown in the previous examples occur in other completely different applications. In this case, a recognizer of images of dogs and cats was trained on the Asirra dataset [11]

name.justification: GPT-2 was employed for the language model experiments in the paper.
name.quote: For this experiment, the GPT-2 model [26] was used.

name.justification: ResNet-18 was used for image classification tasks in the paper.
name.quote: the pretrained ResNet-18 [16] model was fine-tuned on 80% of the training data
